comment.text: We came here for a late dinner on a Friday night and had no wait whatsoever. They specialize in southern Italian food, so it's a nice blend of heavier dishes like Neapolitan pizzas and pastas as well as veggie dishes. They have smaller plates as well as shareable main dishes. We ordered the focaccia, cauliflower, grilled kale salad, and funghi sausage pizza. Everything we had was great, but there were a couple of things that could've been improved; the focaccia came without anything to top it with. I ended up using the focaccia to sop up some of the sauce from the cauliflower, but it would've been nice to have some olive oil or something saucy. The other thing was the fat/bitterness/acid balance of the kale salad- it may have needed a bit more acid. Other than that the pizza and cauliflower were phenomenal, and they had a blueberry seasonal mocktail that was herbal and refreshing. We also had a waiter that was informative and very attentive. Definitely come visit! Try the cauliflower and the pizzas!

owner_replies.comment:
Alesa,

Thank you for dining with us at Double Zero and for sharing such constructive feedback.  We value our guests commentary and are thankful for your honesty!  It's great to hear you enjoyed the cauliflower and our pizza, and we look forward to serving you again!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: We came here for a celebration and our server was absolutely incredible and so kind to our whole group! We had the garlic knots, meatballs, and arancini to start, and all 3 were excellent. The garlic knots are probably the best I've had anywhere. We each had something different for entrees, and with 2 vegetarians at the table, we were all able to find something that left us raving. The COVID practices really put us at ease. Tables were well separated and all employees wore masks. So many employees stopped at our table to check on us and made us feel like family (but also gave us space to enjoy our celebration). A must visit in Emory Village!

owner_replies.comment:
Brandy,

Thank you for choosing Double Zero for your special occasion!  It was our pleasure to celebrate with you.  We love to hear your feedback, especially the comments about our garlic knot! 

Take care, and we hope to see you again soon!

Fred

comment.text: Good Italian themed restaurant. I came here for happy hour drinks after work. We tried the Arancini, cauliflower, and chicken meatball small plates. The portions are definitely small so if you're looking to get the small plates as an appetizer for more than 2 people order quite a few. The food was tasty and service was prompt.

owner_replies.comment:
Taylor,

Thank you for joining us at Double Zero.  It's great to read that you enjoyed yourself.

Fred

comment.text:
I love this place for casual Italian. They're absolutely on point with Covid safety, they provide hand sanitizer at the table, staff wear masks and distancing is observed. 
The service is great...they're friendly, suggestive and treat you better than they need to treat you... the food is fantastic (I recommend arranchini, cauliflower is bomb! the dz meatball with polenta, pizza or chicken parm) 
Parking is easy, there's a big lot just two or three doors up that is open to that strip.
It's on a regular rotating schedule for my little dinner group.

owner_replies.comment:
D, thank you for trusting us to serve you. We are so glad you felt safe joining us and enjoyed your meal. We look forward to serving you again soon.

Take care, 

Fred

comment.text: I ate here for the first time yesterday and this place was amazing. Our waitress (Mya) was incredibly knowledgeable about all the dishes served and the drinks. Everything that she recommended for us to try was amazing. My friend and I had the chicken meatballs and cauliflower for small plates and I had the Halibut dish and it was sooo good. For dessert we had the Butterscotch dessert which was a perfect ending to our meal. Everyone was so friendly and even the general manager checked up on us which was really appreciated. I would definitely recommend trying this restaurant and I can't wait to go back. The food,ambiance and people were an A+.

owner_replies.comment:
Chenelle,

Thank you for dining at Double Zero and for taking a moment to share this feedback.  I will certainly pass on the compliments to Maya, and our General Manager Marissa.  We hope to see you again in the near future.

Thank you!

Fred

comment.text: Love this place! Our waiter was very friendly and helpful with questions about the menu. We ordered the mixed greens and meatball and funghi pizza. The mixed greens came with olives, red peppers, these delicious cheese crisps, salami and an oregano vinaigrette. Very tasty! The pizza crust was absolutely delicious and we loved the twist of cutting it with scissors. Lots of other things to try on the menu so we will definitely be back!

owner_replies.comment:
Rachel,

It was great having you in at Double Zero.  We loved sharing some of our menu with you and look forward to your next visit!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: So, Double Zero is the place you want to love. It has great drinks, wonderful atmosphere, good location [Emory Village] and the staff is attentive and friendly.  Now when it comes to the food, hmmm. Got the chicken meatballs to start and they were good.  So off to a good start I thought, I got the Tagiatelle Bolognese and my companion got the Rigatoni. While technically it's food I wouldn't say it was good food. There was something really off about the pasta and we were both looking forward to having pasta that night. Could have been an off night but it's hard to say.  For all the good reviews we were disappointed.  Would I try it again? sure but I'd have to let the sting from this visit go away first.

owner_replies.comment:
Darren,

Thank you for choosing to visit Double Zero and we are disappointed to hear that you didn't enjoy your experience.  It is very rare to read negative comments about our pasta.  We would love to connect to hear a little more about the specifics - please let me know if you would be willing to have a brief conversation.  We would hate for this to be the lasting impression of our restaurant.

Fred

comment.text: I can not say enough about my experience here. It was after graduation, so I thought it would be busy and our service would be lacking, but it was amazing! Our order was taken quickly, and everything brought out quickly, as well. It all tasted amazing, and everything was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Our waitress was so friendly, and even brought us champagne on the house as well as free appetizer certificates because of the great conversation we had! We would've asked her to sit down and stay with us if she wasn't working. Everything was clean and efficient. I would eat here again and again after this experience!

owner_replies.comment:
Sydney,

Thank you for dining with us at Double Zero and for taking a moment to share your feedback.  We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the experience from start to finish and sincerely look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Fred

comment.text: This has been one of our Italian go-to places. The restaurant itself has a great date-night vibe and the carry-out is very convenient. We always order the Family Bolognese and it never disappoints. Service is also great. We had a mishap with a carry-out order recently. Not only did they comp our meal, they also personally delivered a complimentary dessert.

owner_replies.comment:
Dahshi,

Thank you for sharing this feedback and for being such a loyal guest!  We look forward to serving you again!

Fred

comment.text: Castellucci does it again! Came by this evening with my SO and two friends. Our server was Daniel and he was a great sport, very friendly and fantastic service. We ordered two garlic knots and a Caesar salad for appetizers and were blown away from the start. The garlic knots were delicious- chewy, cheesy, garlicy. They smelled fantastic. The Caesar salad was sublime, and you could tell the dressing was homemade. You don't get a salad like that out of a bottle. It was amazing. For our entrees, we actually opted to not get pizza. My SO got the chicken parm and was delighted when he was brought out a separate portion of giant rigatoni as the pasta accompaniment. The portions are huuuge. One friend got the sausage orecchiette and thought it was delicious (also a giant portion in a huge bowl), and the second friend ordered the lasagna, served in a giant cast iron pan AND an arugula side salad. I ordered the chicken Alfredo, which comes with a hearty, thick, savory Alfredo sauce. The pasta was bucatini which was interesting since traditionally it's fettuccine! All of us had leftovers- you can easily feed 2 people with one entree.. and we LOVE to eat so the portions are definitely massive. 10/10 cannot wait to come back and try their pizzas and desserts.

owner_replies.comment:
Rebecca A.,

Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you.  We are thrilled to read how much you and your party enjoyed your meal and look forward to serving you again!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
This is one of the top restaurants in the CHG restaurant group. My fiancé and i have been many a time and have always had a great experience. The staff is very friendly and help guide you through the menu. We personally enjoy to get a few small plates and then share a pizza or pasta. The many does have changes seasonal which is fantastic. Right now the grilled kale salad is amazing (I know weird thing to say about kale, but the flavors are spot on). The chicken meatballs are super rich and have amazing flavor and you cannot go wrong with any pizza. I personally am a big fan of the OG. 

We will definitely be back many more times to come. This is a great Italian restaurant off the beaten path of your typical midtown or Buckhead.

owner_replies.comment:
Dan,

Thank you for this thoughtful feedback and for taking the time to share your experiences at Double Zero.  It's great to hear that you love the OG DZ pizza - it is also my favorite.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Fred

comment.text:
My husband and I were looking for a nice date night spot near our Decatur home, and this was one of the first spots to catch our eye. A wonderful Italian menu, great drinks list, and a contemporary vibe--wonderful spot. 

The food here is outstanding. Each dish was extremely well balanced, seasoned perfectly, and cooked to perfection. We've tried their pastas, pizzas, and man of their small plates. One night we tried a whole roasted fish dish that the chef had prepared with a garlic, herb salsa verde. It was truly one of the tastiest fish dishes I have ever had. I can not recommend their food enough. 

We've also participated in their pizza making class, which is very fun! They tell all about their dough-making process, then each person gets to stretch their own dough and select toppings for their pizza before it's fired in their ovens. A very fun date night activity!

On top of all of this, their service is fantastic. We've had only the kindest and most attentive wait staff, and their recommendations are always wonderful. Love this place. Cannot recommend it enough!

owner_replies.comment:
Meredith,

Thank you for choosing to dine with us at Double Zero!  It was great to have you for the pizza class and we look forward to many more evenings together!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
Disappointed. 

Starting off, the restaurant is BEAUTIFUL. I've never been to the old location, but the atmosphere is very nice at the new spot. 

We ordered the Pear and Farro Salad and Risotto to start, Lamb Cannelloni, Lobster ravioli and salmon for mains and the pumpkin ginger cake for dessert. For drinks, we tried the bitter truth cocktail and a couple glasses of wine. The cocktail was boozy to say the least, it was several alcohols mixed cold, and poured into a small glass and garnished with a whole slice of red pepper. Hard to drink, and not at all elegant in the presentation. The server was nice, and tried to be accommodating but honestly didn't seem like she knew much about wine. Stark contrast with the Italian-inspired restaurant in Decatur who seems to always have a sommelier on staff? 

The pear and farro salad was not worth ordering. It was a base of seasoned farro which was actually tasty, then like 3 paper thin slices of pear, then big chunks of sliced endive on top which seemed like an afterthought. It was served with salad tongs with teeth so wide it couldn't pick up the farro, so we ended up eating raw bitter endive with bits of farro stuck to it. 

Risotto was tasty, except it was barely risotto. There's so much stuff in it, that there actually wasn't that much rice. The creamy texture of risotto is what's so nice about it! 

As much as they try to tell you the mains and pasta are meant for sharing, it's not. They're small portions, and not served in anyway that makes them easy to share. They're far from 'family style' which is how it was described to us. What it feels like is tapping off of the 'small plates' trend and selling less food for higher prices. The lamb cannelloni and lobster ravioli were good, but not worth the high price tag. I will say the salmon was a very large portion and cooked to perfection, though the spaghetti squash/veggie mixture just didn't seem to go well with the salmon at all. 

The star of the show was the pumpkin ginger cake. It was exactly what you'd expect from the name, just enough spice, not too sweet, very moist, super flavorful. One of the best desserts I've had in a restaurant in a long time. 

All in all, this was a disappointment. Some things were winners, others were fails, but for the reputation and caliber that this restaurant is supposed to be, didn't experience it for this dinner. I will go back and try the pizza.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Vivi,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback - we value the opinions of our guests as we are constantly trying to improve.  I am disappointed to hear that your expectations were not met at Double Zero.  It sounds like you were least impressed with the pear farro salad and I can understand your frustration with the size of the salad tongs.  I also wish we were able to deliver a better value perception as it appears you were underwhelmed by the sizes of some of the dishes.  Family style is not exactly our goal with those sections of the menu and I can see how that would have been misleading.

I would welcome you back to try the pizza as we would love the opportunity to try and make a better impression.  Please feel free to reach out to me personally when you do so.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: First off, the inside looks amazing. But a couple issues for me. This is the second time I've been here for takeout and it's the second time none of the doors were open and none of the staff were paying attention to the doors. Then I had instructions I put in the notes about cutting the pizza (since they don't do that because of their ingredients) and just a side of pizza sauce. Neither of those were done for me. Great spot but it's 0/2 for me and I don't plan to make a third.

owner_replies.comment:
Zach,

Thanks for choosing Double Zero!  We regret that both experiences were not perfect.  We of course strive for better and I know how frustrating it can be when your order isn't just right.  Can you share your email address so we can get in touch directly?

Thank you!

Fred

comment.text:
I am temporarily staying in the area and wanted to experience the great food that Atlanta has to offer. I did some research to find out what restaurant had the best pasta. Well, Double Zero frequently came up so I decided to take a look at the menu. At first I was nervous because of the hefty price. I ordered the Bolognese to-go. 

So I finally arrive to pick up my food and the restaurant instantly shocked me. The vibe was on point. It was so beautiful. I immediately texted my boyfriend to tell him he needs to bring me here for a date lol. The staff was so friendly and nice. I went to the bar to pick up my order and was a bit disappointed by the portion of my food.

When I got home and took that first bite. OMG BEST PASTA I'VE EVER HAD. I could tell the noodles were made from scratch and the meat sauce was so good! It ended up being the perfect portion size because I was stuffed. I forced myself to finish every bite because I could not stop eating it. I can not wait to come back and try dining in. If take-out was so good, then dining in must be phenomenal.

owner_replies.comment:
Tyler,

It's wonderful to read this feedback about your experience at Double Zero!  We are thrilled that the bolognese wowed you and look forward to sharing more of our menu on your next date night!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
It was close to a 5, but only one fail.

The good.

Seated super fast with no reservation on a Friday at 8pm.
Great friendly service from John, never felt ignored or pressured.
Place had a nice open feel.

Food
Chicken meatballs with risotto was fantastic.  The thinly sliced fresh garlic that was fried was super yumm. Risotto was perfect. Just wished there was more, but those items where meant to be tapas in nature.

My wife had the tagliatelle and it too was OUTSTANDING. The meat had a slight crunch texture from a panko season mixture that made the dish sing.  The meat to noodle ratio was a bit off, in favor of the meat, but no one is complaining. Actually added it to my pizza.

I had the Margherita pizza, and this was the only ding.  At first I loved the idea of cutting my own pie with scissors, but the novelty quickly wore off. Maybe because I was gussied up for the night and did not want to stain my nice duds and I was starving. In the end I found having to cut the pizza with some cheap scissors to be an small inconvenience. The pizza was a bit over sauced which caused it to be exceedingly limp and soggy, but it made for easy cutting.  I will say that it reheated nicely on my cast iron skillet moments ago and with a crisp crust, it was fantastic.

Drink
Beer selection was small, but I did not expect 32 beers on tap at an Italian joint. The wine and cocktail options where better, for the wife found a tasty red that was spicy and just dry enough.
 
We will be back.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Scott,

Thank you for the thorough review of your experience at Double Zero.  We are happy to hear that we impressed you and your wife in so many different aspects of the dining experience.  Bummer that you weren't a fan of the scissors - we have done this since we opened and like that's it a little different an playful.  We can always cut it differently for you if you prefer! Just ask!  We are looking forward to serving you again soon.

Fred

comment.text:
Great atmosphere, food and customer service!  Corrie, our server was excellent!  Always around at the right time, and her dessert recommendation was on par!
Also, she wrote down the wine that I was enjoying.  Now to find that Grenache/Syrah from France!

owner_replies.comment:
Karen,

Thank you for dining with us at Double Zero! We enjoyed the opportunity to serve you and are thrilled to read about your experience with Corrie.  We hope to serve you again!

Fred

comment.text:
AMAZINGGGG SERVICE !!
My friend and I were looking for a relaxed yet elegant place to spend our evening . Alex and our server Grayson were very attentive food was delicious and seasoned perfectly had chicken parmesan for the first time 10/10 .

owner_replies.comment:
Venus,

Thank you for sharing this feedback about your experience at Double Zero.  It was our pleasure to serve you and we are excited for another opportunity soon.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: This was the best Italian food we've had so far in Atlanta.  The service was great, the drinks were delicious and the food was so amazing!!  Definitely order the garlic knot and the chicken "fried" Parmesan! We will definitely be back again.

owner_replies.comment:
Amy,

Thank you for dining at Double Zero!  We love to read such a complimentary review of your evening, and we are proud to have offered such a great experience.  We look forward to your return visit.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
Nice pizza, ambiance, very knowledgeable server, great selection of beverages, especially bourbon n scotch, and appetizers. A bit too pricy appetizers and non pizza items. We shared a Divola pizza which was very nice but a big soggy in the middle. Overall an okay experience.

Fred, thank you sooo much for your response, I have a lot of respect for a business owner reaching out and responding to their customers. I was not disappointed with my dinner, just a couple of minor things but will definitely return as others In my party really did enjoy their experience as did I.

Thanks.

owner_replies.comment:
Yogesh,

Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback about your experience at Double Zero.  I apologize that we were unable to meet your expectations on value and would love the opportunity to deliver a dining experience that better suits your preferences.  Please let me know if you would open to trying us again!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
Great food!!
Awesome service and the lamb pasta is a must eat! The mushroom pizza is delicious as well as the fresh arugula pizza.

owner_replies.comment:
Sana,

We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your experience at Double Zero! We look forward to your next visit.

Fred

comment.text:
It pains me a bit to write this review a bit because we loved the old location of Double Zero while it was still in Sandy Springs. Additionally, we love all the Castellucci restaurants in the area. However, the tapas style menu has its hits and misses. 

We started with multiple of the small plates. The Burrata Panzenella was very salty, and it was the cheese itself that was salty which surprised us. The Gnochi di Pollo also underwhelmed with the dish being a little different that we expected, with the chicken thigh being a slab of dry chicken on the side of the gnocchi. 

Highlights from the small plates were the grilled kale and the smoked brisket arancini. But overall the variety of small plates that we loved about the old location was cut in half at the new location, especially with many of the meat options cut out of the truncated new menu. 

We wanted to try the Lamb Cannelloni but unfortunately it was sold out for the night. Instead, we got tagliatelle bolognese and orecchiette pasta. Both solid pastas but not amazing. We also got a Margherita pizza that just didn't seem as delicately prepared as the old restaurant. 

The service was uneven on the night as well. Unfortunately, there was a problem with the "dough" so it took quite a long time for our pizzas to come out. Additionally, we did not get the eggplant appetizer we ordered as well. Since it was a birthday celebration and for our delay, we got complimentary champagne at the end along with a free dessert for our troubles. 

We were disappointed at our night at Double Zero just because we had so many fond memories of the old Double Zero. I hope that they expand the small plate menu a bit to include old favorites like the lamb and the mozzarella al forno. There unfortunately are better options in the Atlanta area for great Italian food.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Kapil,

Thank you for being such a loyal patron of our restaurants - we appreciate there are many options across the city and we are very thankful you have so many times chosen to dine with us.  

I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the grilled kale salad and the arancini, but I am disappointed to read that Double Zero no longer meets your expectations on an overall level.  It seems very unusual that there would be any issue at all with the dough for the pizza, so I am looking into that specifically.  You are not alone in missing some of the original menu items and we are considering featuring some of the items you mentioned when we undergo our next seasonal menu change.  

We would certainly like the opportunity to improve and to win you back as a customer at Double Zero.  Please let me know if you are open to connecting a private channel so we can further discuss.

Thank you,

Fred

comment.text:
Delightful Italian food in this hidden-away locale! Should be visited by more people!


FOOD
Ordered the ORECCHIETTE E SALSICCIA which was delightful.

The Grana Padano foam sauce looks translucent, but it is still very creamy! I've never had foam so it was an experience!

Very delicious flavors with the sausage and broccolini yet light and flavorful. Perfectly cooked orecchiette pasta as well. It is the creamy pasta dish I've been craving ever since.


ATMOSPHERE
Nice modern decor with big mosaic furnaces for firing pizza. There was a bar area that sort of separate from the restaurant with neon lights and more of a hipster Little Trouble vibe that I'd like to check out next time!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Connie!

Thank you for checking out Double Zero and for sharing some feedback about your experience. We enjoyed serving you and look forward to seeing you at for a visit to our bar!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: This place is sure to satisfy your tastebuds.  From the apps, to the main courses, to the drinks, to the desserts--there wasn't one time that my dining companion and I weren't impressed with the flavors.  It's in a nice big space so you don't feel cramped, yet it somehow still felt cozy.  There was some kinda hiccough with the service (that probably shouldnt have manifested itself as obvious as it did), but once that wrinkle was ironed out it really was a great dining experience.  It would make a good date spot, because it still has that intimate vibe, but could work for larger groups--there were about two parties of 10 or so.  I'd say it's one of my top places to enjoy elevated Italian cuisine.

owner_replies.comment:
Luis,

Thank you for choosing to dine at Double Zero and we appreciate you sharing such thorough feedback on your experience.  We apologize for the slight misstep from a service perspective, but very happy we were able to overcome that with you and your guest.  We look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: Trying to find my favorite Italian spot in the area and this one hit the mark! The front end staff is super friendly and welcoming and so was our server Robin. Love the way this restaurant handled precautions during COVID too as we dined in. I recommend the garlic knot (it's not what you think), and shrimp pasta! Will definitely come back.

owner_replies.comment:
Jennifer,

Thank you for choosing to dine with us and for taking a moment to share this feedback about Double Zero!  Happy to know you enjoyed everything and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Fred

comment.text:
This is an excellent restaurant, excellent.  

The food is outstanding, there is always a table and the parking is easy.  It is the same ownership as Cooks and Soldiers.

We started coming here as an escape from the subtourists in Inman Park but now it is our Italian go to.  If you are local, you need to check this out.

Service is great too, Nick and John at the bar will steer you right on wine or cocktails.

Again, travel and entertain for work, I don't know much, but I do know food.

owner_replies.comment:
Geremy,

Thank you for sharing this feedback about your experiences at Double Zero.  We enjoy the opportunity to serve you and love to know we are your go to spot for Italian.  We look forward to seeing you soon.

Fred

comment.text: The margherita pizza here is so delicious.  And the new fungi salad is the perfect salad for Autumn.  Well, any season really!  If they bring back the seasonal farro, order it for sure.  I do takeout and outdoor dining here, and once, a pizza making class which was so fun.  Highly recommend Double Zero.  Oh, and the staff are all terrific too.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you, Lori!  We appreciate you sharing your thoughts about dining experience at Double Zero.  It is always our pleasure to serve you.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: OMG, Double Zero was truly remarkable. I love their ambience. The staff are extremely attentive and friendly and they're great at giving recommendations. I enjoyed everything I have ordered here. Double Zero is definitely a special place.

owner_replies.comment:
Jeffrey,

It was our pleasure to serve you.  Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback about your experience.  We look forward to your next visit.

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
My partner and I tried Double Zero on an impromptu date night and it was fine, but not great. I kind of expected more based on my stellar experiences at Iberian Pig (same restaurant group/owners).

Let's start with service. Service was great! Five stars there. We were greeted, seated, and taken care of. Our server provided suggestions and spoke with the kitchen on our behalf when we had questions about vegetarian options. 

Food is where things fell a little short for me. We started with a dish called "grilled kale", and I was fully expecting grilled kale. Maybe I should have asked more questions, but the dish was more of an arugula salad with a few pieces of grilled kale scattered through. It was good... but I wanted kale, not arugula. Next, we tried the hummus and opted to have it served with raw veggies vs. bread since we were also getting a pizza (gotta watch the carbs). I certainly appreciated the raw veggie option but the hummus was lackluster. It was a bit watery and lacked depth of flavor. It was just missing something.  For our main course, we ordered the Cavolfiore pizza. It was my favorite part of the dinner for sure. It's a vegetarian pizza with chili marinated cauliflower, olives, leeks, and roasted red pepper. Just the right amount of spice and a perfect crust. I also enjoyed how the pizza was served with scissors to cut. Definitely easier than a pizza slicer. I had to google this because it was a new experience for me and apparently scissors are the way to go in Italy. Very authentic!

Lastly, the atmosphere.. it was very low key when we were there on a Thursday evening. The space is nice though so I would imagine it can get quite busy and bustling on the weekends. This would be a good date night spot or a good place to grab a drink, too. The bar is nice and they have a lot of unique cocktail options.  Definitely worth checking out.

owner_replies.comment:
Lindsey,

Thank you for checking us out on your date night -- we hope it will be the first of many!  We appreciate the feedback on some of the dishes you tried, especially the hummus and the kale salad.  We are always trying to improve so I plan to share these notes with the culinary team so we can work on consistency.  Visit us again soon!

Fred

comment.text: Usually pretty good but today  I'm disgusted. I can't believe they're opening the doors to the public when one of their employees just tested positive with covid. They're barely taking precautions to make sure it doesn't spread.

owner_replies.comment:
Melanie,

Thank you for taking the time to write your review. It allows for us to convey the steps that we take to ensure the safety of our team and guests. Any opportunity that we have to share this information, we are happy to do so as it is something that CANNOT be taken lightly. 

Our restaurant is following the guidelines of the CDC in all aspects, and we have chosen to take these guidelines even further throughout our daily operations which is mentioned in many other reviews on other platforms by actual guests who have dined with us. It is extremely important to all of us that this be felt with confidence by everyone who walks through our doors.

The person who is mentioned in your review had not been in the building for over a week when this information was learned. The contact that they had with others based on the CDC guidelines was minimal. All who had that level of contact were notified, and have not been back in the building since. They have all received testing, and will not be returning until they provide their results. 

A very well respected company was brought in to sterilize the entire building and the contents within it hours after we had received this information. This guaranteed that we would be able to have a safe environment for everyone to enter our building. 

We can assure you that Double Zero and everyone who is involved takes these matters very seriously, and can state with absolute certainty that this environment is a safe place to be. This requires the participation of everyone by wearing masks, washing hands effectively, and sanitizing all surfaces. For our team, it means conducting ourselves wisely when we are not in the building to show respect to our fellow co-workers and guests. 

Opening to the public for the past few months has been a sensitive subject for everyone in our industry, including our employees. We are respectful of those feelings by operating with the utmost integrity and dedication to safety. I welcome any further conversation that you would like to have regarding this or any other matter by calling the restaurant.

comment.text: My lamb was very delicious, tender and the portion was enough for two ppl . I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Margaret K.

Thank you for choosing to dine at Double Zero! We are happy that you enjoyed your experience and we hope to have the chance to serve you again in the near future.


All the best,

Fred

comment.text: SUCH GOOD FOOD!!!! a wonderfully sophisticated restaurant and so comfortable to be in. the staff was super sweet and attentive. i got the lasagna (huge portion!! saved half for leftovers) and you can tell all their ingredients are fresh and really good quality which makes the price so worth it.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you, Rebecca! 

It was our pleasure to serve you at Double Zero and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Fred

comment.text:
I don't even know where to begin. Hands down some of the best Italian food in Atlanta. Came here on a Saturday night with my bff for dinner at 7:30 this past weekend. Valet was full but I snagged a street spot right in front of the restaurant. The location is on N. Decatur near the round about and next door to Rise-n-Dine. 

Walking in I was shocked by how spacious the place is. We were seated to the left at a two seater high top and on the right there's a big dining room with more traditional table seating. There's also a bar set up to the far left and in the back you can see the open kitchen area. 

We were ready for a carb feast and wanted to try everything. We started off with a bottle of Viognier which was perfect and ordered the chicken meatballs and arancini to start. The meatballs were very good but ohmygosh the arancini was to die for. I was trying to eat it slowly to savor it. I recommend ordering your own set of arancini because you probably won't want to share. Next we shared a margherita pizza which was simple yet amazing. We found ourselves using the last bits of crust to scoop up any remaining marinara. We were still ready for more so I ordered the short rib cannelloni and she had the mushroom pappardelle. I'm not a mushroom fan so I didn't try hers but she cleaned the plate so it must've been good. I really enjoyed the unique flavors of my cannelloni which had a slight vinegar taste to each bite. I ended up having leftovers of it and Michael our waiter wrapped it up for me to go. 

The service here was top notch. Michael always seemed to stop by at the right time and I guess he saw how enamored we were with our meal and gave us a free small plate coupon. I plan on using it in a few days because I need to get back here ASAP!

owner_replies.comment:
Tiffany,

Thank you for dining at Double Zero and for sharing this feedback about your experience.  It is excellent to read that you enjoyed your meal and the service.  I will be sure to pass along the comments to Michael, he will greatly appreciate it.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again soon.

Fred

comment.text: Really enjoyed the dinner and experience at Double Zero! It's located in Emory village, so very convenient for those of us that live in Druid Hills and Decatur. The space itself is huge and pretty. A friend and I didn't have any troubles getting a table at 7 on a Saturday night. I ordered the kale salad, which was probably one of the better kale salads I've had! Lots of flavor with the lemon and garlic dressing, bread crumbs, spices and light cheese. I'd actually go back just for the salad. I also ordered the margarita pizza with an egg on top! The crust was perfect - light and tasty. The server brought out a pair of scissors to cut it (which I thought was odd) but definitely worked better than the knife. My friend had a pasta she really liked. Our server was VERY knowledgeable, kind and attentive. We will be back to the great restaurant in our neighborhood!'

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Anna!

Thank you for choosing to dine at Double Zero and for sharing some feedback from your experience. I am so happy to hear you found some unforgettable items and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: This place is wonderful. Lovely simple but elegant decor. Most of the dishes are small plates, which are great for sharing. We had a simple, well-balanced arugula salad and delicious pork belly with a melt in your mouth Farro. The canneloni was hearty and so tasty. To top it off, the butterscotch budino was to die for! A creamy, not too sweet panacotta topped with an amazing sea salt caramel... And a yummy cookie. Crystallized rosemary on top was another detail showing the skill and creativity of this restaurant. We loved it all. Our server, Maya (senior ) was friendly and helpful. We will be back!

owner_replies.comment:
Rachel,

Thank you for taking a moment to share this feedback about your experience at Double Zero.  We love to read that you enjoyed your meal and the hospitality.  We look forward to serving you again in the near future!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text:
Love this place! I was able to make a reservation with short notice for a party of 8.  The space was great.  Busy but intimate.  I didn't feel like I had to shout to be heard.  

They offer small plates, pastas and pizzas.  In our group of 8, we were able to sample from each.  My top two faves were the artichoke al forno (a cheesy dip) and the funghi pizza.  Almost everything I had sampled was wonderful.   The only exception was the octopus which was quite dry and bland.  

I would highly recommend going as a small group like we did so more dishes can be shared! I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.
Double Zero was amazing. Our server was Rita and she was the absolute best! One of the most kind and attentive servers and a wonderful person as well!

owner_replies.comment:
Alex,

It was fantastic to have the opportunity to serve you! Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to serving you in the future!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: This is not what you think when you think Italian I understand that the dish must be small, but they are overpriced and underwhelming. I got the whole fish it was ok but but vary disappointing for how they endorsed it definitely not impressed

owner_replies.comment: Hi Lucas - thank you for the feedback on your recent dining experience at Double Zero.  At Double Zero we are trying to push the envelope on a new style of Italian, taking a spin on family style that is so popular in the Italian culture.  Our dishes are smaller by design so guests can try and taste many items all within one meal.  I apologize if this was not communicated to you at the table and do wish we had the opportunity to guide you better. Please let me know if you are in town again, as we would welcome the chance to try to win you back! Take care.

comment.text:
I don't know how to rate this restaurant higher. This IS our go-to spot to take guests who are looking for something unique, unexpected, cosmopolitan - and delicious! 

There's no doubt I was concerned at first after they moved in town and changed their menu. After all, we were big fans of the original location's menu, staff, and atmosphere: urban chic meets pizza and pasta.

But after several visits to the new location, they clearly upped their food game with an eclectic, gourmet take on small plates while maintaining some Italian staples. Most of the wonderful staff moved with them, and the atmosphere is even more electric. 

Words can't even describe how good the Arancini meatballs are.  They are a must-have!!!

Castellucci's personal involvement is both evident and welcome - and we continue to love everything about this place.

Everything we ordered came cold, including the pizza! The appetizer Arancini was completely flavorless. Service was okay and we we offered a free dessert for all the inconveniences, but for a place that's supposed to be known for good pizza, it arriving cold killed the experience.  Not sure how this place made it onto the Food Network, which is why we visited.

owner_replies.comment:
Lauren,

Thank you for choosing to dine with us at Double Zero.  We apologize that the experience left so much to be desired. We strive for much better! Please share your email address if you would be willing to connect directly.

Fred

comment.text: I have been waiting to try this amazing place for quite sometime and I finally went and OMG why in the hell have I been waiting!!!!! It was absolutely beyond good, amazing, delicious and perfection!!!! Me and my bestie kinda did a tour of the menu lol. We started off with arancini and chicken meatballs, my bestie said the arancini was really good I didn't taste them because I don't eat beef and they were made with brisket but those chicken meatballs with polenta smack your lips amazing!! The meatballs were seasoned perfectly and so juicy man I was in heaven. We also ordered a bottle of wine which was amazing but I can't remember the name due to my bestie picked it out but they have an amazing wine list that is not mentioned on the website but its awesome. We them ordered the margherita pizza and boy oh boy amazing is an understatement because it literally was the best margherita pizza I have had in Atlanta, I'm drooling just thinking about it. The sauce was perfect and the dough was just delicious!!! We finished off with pasta, I had the Pappardelle which was knock your socks off fresh and the mushrooms it was pure perfection not a lot of sauce but enough to coat the noodles and you can definitely taste the freshness of the pasta and my bestie had the cannelloni which she said was amazing. We absoluted our meal and enjoyed our time at Double Zero and will definitely be back. The atmosphere was great, nice decor and very friendly and attentive staff. The parking situation just an FYI they do have valet but it was full at 7:30 on a Saturday night but I found free street parking. I wish I could give 10 stars because they definitely exceeded my expectations!!!!!

owner_replies.comment:
Mia,

Thank you for dining at Double Zero and thank you so much for sharing this detailed feedback about your experience.  It was our pleasure to serve you and we look forward to welcoming you back!

Fred

comment.text: We really enjoyed Double Zero at the old location.  New location - guess they are looking for a different client base that is willing to pay more for less.  $17 for the Carni pizza which was mainly pizza crust and sauce with a little sausage, cheese and salumi???  Server kept asking us if we wanted wine with our meal.  Too pushy - felt obligated and we ordered wine.  More drinks = more profit.  No thank you.  Too many other great restaurants to choose from.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Chris - 

Thank you for sharing your feedback and I apologize you did not perceive the value in this specific experience. Your pizza does not look as composed as most of our pizzas. I hope you mentioned this to your server, as I know our chef would have been happy to make another for you. As for the service, I will speak to the general manager and ask her to address this with your server. We do not teach this type of service and welcome guests to enjoy a meal however they choose - whether that includes alcohol or not. I would love the opportunity to serve you again at Double Zero so we could try to make a better impression. Please let me know if you would be willing to connect on a private channel to make such arrangements. Thank you!

comment.text: I had the Fay Wray as a drink, it was great especially with the Rosemary. I would recommend the Arugula as a salad. You can definitely taste all the flavors and not overwhelming. I had the Rigatoni and added Prosciutto it was absolutely delicious. The shortbread was alright, kind of dry. The service was also great and everything was very clean. Will definitely be back.

owner_replies.comment:
Michael,

Thank you for dining with us at Double Zero.  It's great to read this feedback about your experience.  We hope to welcome you back soon.

Fred

comment.text:
I've been here twice; the first time soon after it opened. I really liked it. I don't go back to many restaurants because there are so many to try, but I've gone back here. It also helps that I was able to get reservations on short notice. 

Many restaurants these days create an ambience by creating noise. Double Zero has some noise but it's possible to have a conversation without yelling even with the tables that are a little long (the better for ordering more food). The first time I went our server was super friendly but his nails were really dirty, almost as if he worked in a garage during the day. At my second visit we had two proper servers and a trainee. They were just okay and actually seemed a little rushed. Less personable.

The funghi pizza is really, really good. I've ordered it twice. It has a nice mushroom sort of cream sauce as its base. It's very light though with a very intense mushroom flavor. The mushrooms on the pizza are beyond button and also very flavorful. The pizza is drizzled with some light lettuces. The first time there was a hint of lemon on the lettuces adding a nice surprise to a bite. 

The polenta has chicken broth in it but the chef was able to make it vegetarian for me. This always makes me like a place more. I had it the first time I went and if I recall correctly it was good but not amazing. The broccoli was surprisingly good while the take on burrata was good but a bit small. My friend really liked the meatballs. For some reason I ordered the artichoke tip during my second visit. I think I got stuck on the idea of artichokes even after I learned it was just an artichoke dip. For what it's worth, I really enjoyed it and while it may or may not have had a ton of calories, it didn't feel too heavy. 

Unlike, say Barcelona, which gives really small small plates, the servings here are a good size.

The service here is 5 stars but the food is really hit or miss. The kale salad and the cauliflower were excellent. You should pass on the dry, flavorless Arancini. The pizza dough was perfect but the tomato sauce was a bit too salty.  The dessert was great. I would still return but maybe next time I'll ask to taste the tomato sauce before they make me my pizza!

owner_replies.comment:
Irene,

Thank you for choosing to dine at Double Zero!  We regret that the experience was less than perfect and we appreciate the feedback on the arancini and the pizza sauce.  We look forward to welcoming you again soon, and hopefully having the opportunity to correct these mis-steps!

Take care,

Fred

comment.text: I need to update my review because a friend convinced me to go back here and I am now sure we caught Double Zero on an off night on our first visit.  On the return visit the service was excellent and the food was delicious.  Our favorites were the focaccia, the orecchiette and the butterscotch pudding.  Would definitely go back for a date night.  Double zero has redeemend itself!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Pam,

Thank you so much for giving us a second try and hearing this feedback means the world to us.  Thank you for trusting us again and we look forward to serving you many more times!

Thank you.

Fred

comment.text:
If you've been to the old location on Roswell Rd, be prepared. The menu here is completely different. While I did miss some of the old menu items, the brisket arancini was melt in your mouth amazing! 

We noshed on a few small plates and shared a bottle of wine. They have a good assortment at very reasonable restaurant prices. Both of the Tempranillos on the menu were solid. 

The new bar setup looks awesome, and supposedly they do a lot of tastings there now. Will definitely have to check this out as they had out of this world amazing cocktails at the Roswell Rd location. I can only assume they're just as good in Decatur. 

Parking is a little confusing since this is in Emory village. There is street parking available and parking behind the building. I believe it's valet only on busier nights, so bring cash just in case.

I am legit loving this place. I've been there twice in the past month, and just loved every moment. The drinks are very creative (if you're nice, you can even ask the bar lead to make you a custom drink based on the liquor of your choice as well as undertones you desire). Food is delicious - super fresh (quite a refreshing contrast with the typical Atlantan food!). Their pasta is made in-house as well as their pizza. Just 10s all across the board for me. Most importantly, as a native New Yorker, I pride myself on knowing a good slice of pizza. Their pizza is not your typical NY slice but definitely a more traditional take of an authentic Italian slice (cue hand talk) ... But really, the last time I had pizza this good was in Naples. Slightly burnt in the ferrara oven .. MmmmMm. What are you waiting for? Go already!

owner_replies.comment:
Jenn,

Thank you for dining with us at Double Zero!  We appreciate you sharing all of this feedback and love to know you appreciate the authenticity of our Neapolitan pizza!  We look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Fred

comment.text: My hubby and I had a great time tonight for New Year's Eve! The food was terrific and the drinks were great! We had a really good time sitting and munching and drinking...a very special time! The server was great also! We will be back!

owner_replies.comment:
Mary,

Thank you for choosing to spend such a special occasion with us and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!  

Happy New Year,

Fred

comment.text:
Best wedding EVER! 
Thank you to everyone for an absolutely perfect night. My daughter's wedding at Double Zero was amazing! 
Fun, relaxed vibe & delicious food! From apps, thru the salads, on to the entrees- beautifully presented, soooo good! The drinks were great! Then pizzas to close out the party. Yummmmmmy! 
All of the servers were on pointe- friendly, and attentive. They all went above & beyond to ensure that each of our guests were happy. Oh my God, the food- out of this world!! 
Planning was fun & thoughtful. The couple chose an outstanding menu. The party was great! The desserts were suburb! 
Can't wait to return to celebrate another occasion.

owner_replies.comment:
Beth,

It was an honor to be a part of this special day.  Thank you for choosing Double Zero!

Fred
